text: while the idea of breakfast in bed on
Mother's Day may sound like a good idea
I actually prefer to get my family
together in the kitchen and cook
something that everyone's going to love
so this year in the Test Kitchen we were
inspired by the southern classic fried
chicken and waffles the fried chicken
that we're going to do today is actually
oven fried chicken and it's super easy
and you can prepare it the night before
every little bit of this is something
that kids can help out with so this is
something they could do get the brine
ready for the chicken it is 2 cups of
buttermilk and the chicken is going to
be so moist and tender with the
buttermilk 1 tablespoon of Dijon mustard
just for some flavor 2 teaspoons of a
coarse salt this will also bring out all
the great flavors and season the chicken
and a half a teaspoon of freshly ground
black pepper whisk this together now I'm
going to use thighs and drumsticks they
really work the best when you're doing
an oven fried chicken so I have two and
a half pounds skinless thighs and
drumsticks you want this to chill at
least three hours to get it nice and
tender or you could do this overnight
just let it sit so it's ready to go the
next morning and then we can make the
coating ok our chicken is out of the
fridge it's nice and tender eyes too now
let's make the crumb topping so I have 8
cups of corn flakes in the food
processor and I want to grind them down
to fine crumbs
okay cut a few little pieces they're a
little bit bigger which is nice for
texture and the cornflakes really stay
crunchy in the oven so that's the bonus
so into this mixture a half a cup of
flour this will help it adhere and two
tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil
okay and two teaspoons of salt
give this a mix okay this looks nicely
mixed so now we need our eggs two eggs
just crack them into a bowl something
large enough that you can get chicken
piece in whisk together perfect okay so
I'm going to use some tongs to take the
chicken out you want to let some of this
buttermilk mixture drip off a bit
then we'll go into the egg just turn it
to coat now into the crumbs coat it all
around kind of press it on to make it it
here and this goes right onto a wire
rack over a baking sheet just like that
I'm going to keep coating all these
pieces and then these will go into a
425-degree oven take about 35 minutes to
get them fully cooked through be nice
and golden-brown once you have all the
pieces done do a teaspoon of oil over
the top of each piece this will really
make that coating nice and crisp and
golden okay time to make the buttermilk
coat waffles and what's great about this
recipe is the other half of the quart of
buttermilk that you used on the chicken
you get to use in the waffles so you get
to use the whole thing up and no waste
you start with 1 cup of flour and 1 cup
of quick cooking oats these are the
finer oats that will kind of fluff up
nicely in the waffle so one cup of those
1 teaspoon of baking soda and 1 and 1/2
teaspoons of baking powder these are the
leaveners that'll give us nice fluffy
waffles of course we need salt 3/4 of a
teaspoon coarse salt
and three tablespoons of brown sugar
this will give a nice caramel sweetness
to the waffles I'm just going to whisk
them together to combine good now for
our wet ingredients for large egg yolks
and we're going to use the whites later
so just separate the egg yolks then we
have one stick of melted and slightly
cooled butter we don't want to cook our
eggs at this point so I'm just going to
whisk it in two cups of the buttermilk a
teaspoon of vanilla extract my favorite
flavor to add to just about anything
those are our wet ingredients and they
are going to go right into the dry
ingredients mix this up then those egg
whites that we separated from the yolks
I've beaten they're stiff but not dry so
they're just perfect for folding in this
will give it some nice lightness and
lift to the waffle just keep folding
until you don't see any more streaks of
white let's get our waffle iron and get
cooking the waffle irons been preheating
it's ready to go I'm just going to
quickly spray it with some nonstick
spray and then the batter is so nice and
fluffy ladle it in
I have to fill it about 3/4 full it'll
take about 4 mints depends on your
waffle iron this one's nice and hot
steam will start to escape and when the
steam starts to subside it's time to
check and see if it's nice and
golden-brown beautiful so I'm going to
continue to make all my waffles check on
my chicken and get them all together so
our chicken is done it looks amazing and
nice and golden-brown so let's get a
waffle on the plate and I think I'll
have a drumstick put that right on top
and I've made a spicy maple butter it's
just softened butter with some maple
syrup and a hot sauce like a Tabasco a
little bit of salt so delicious and then
top it off a little bit of maple syrup
and that's it
this is the ultimate in savory sweet
combination the whole family is going to
love it especially mom
